sources.title: Creepshow (1982)
sources.description: Creepshow is a 1982 American horror comedy anthology film directed by George A. Romero and written by Stephen King in his screenwriting debut. The filmÂ  features five short stories, framed by a prologue and epilogue involving a boy named Billy who is punished by his father for reading a horror comic. The segments include tales of a vengeful zombie father, a meteor that causes bizarre transformations, a husband seeking revenge, a mysterious creature in a crate, and a businessman overwhelmed by cockroaches.

metadata.Plot: Five tales of terror are presented. The first deals with a demented old man returning from the grave to get the Father's Day cake his murdering daughter never gave him. The second is about a not-too-bright farmer discovering a meteor that turns everything into plant-life. The third is about a vengeful husband burying his wife and her lover up to their necks on the beach. The fourth is about a creature that resides in a crate under the steps of a college. The final story is about an ultra-rich businessman who gets his comeuppance from cockroaches.
metadata.Actors: Hal Holbrook, Leslie Nielsen, Adrienne Barbeau
